sen.j: 惟宗忠康（これむね の ただやす、生年未詳 - 1179年?）〔橋口右衛門尉〕は、秦氏後裔で、摂関家（藤原氏）に仕えた京侍。
sen.e: Tadayasu KOREMUNE (date of birth unknown - 1179?) [Uemon no jo Hashiguchi] was a descendent of the Hata clan and a Samurai of Kyoto, who served Sekkan-ke (the family (Fujiwara clan) which produced regents).

KOREMUNE Tadayasu (also known as Uemon no jo Hashiguchi, year of birth unknown - 1179?) was a descendent of the Hata clan and a Samurai of Kyoto, who served Sekkan-ke (namely, the families which produced the Regent and the Chief Adviser to the Emperor).
sen.cmt: 読みを原文に合わせ、表現を変えました。

sen.j: 子：忠広（上総国前司）．忠久（豊後国守）．忠季（兵衛尉）。
sen.e: His sons were Tadahiro (Kazusa no kuni no zenji (the former official of Kazusa Province)), Tadahisa (Bungo no kuni no Kami (Governor of Bungo Province), and Tadasue (Hyoe no jo (Lieutenant of the Middle Palace Guards)).

sen.j: 島津忠久の広言養子説は、後に丹後局が惟宗広言の妻になった縁により、忠久・忠季も広言の養子となったものとする説。
sen.e: The KOREMUNE no Hirokoto's adopted son theory' about Tadahisa SHIMAZU, presumes that Tadahisa as well as Tadasue were adopted by Hirokoto, based on the fact that Tango no tsubone became Hirokoto's wife later.
sen.cmt: 島津忠久の広言養子説→定訳不明：'The KOREMUNE no Hirokoto's adopted son theory' about Tadahisa SHIMAZU としました。
sen.e: There is a theory that Tadahisa SHIMAZU was adopted KOREMUNE no Hirokoto together with Tadasue, because Hirokoto took Tango no tsubone to wife later.
